## TileOffsetUtils namespace

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare namespace TileOffsetUtils 
```

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [extractOffsetAndMortonKeyFromKey(key, bitshift)](./harp-mapview.tileoffsetutils.extractoffsetandmortonkeyfromkey.md) | Extracts the offset and morton key from the given key (must be created by: \[\[getKeyForTileKeyAndOffset\]\])<!-- -->Note, we can't use bitshift operators in Javascript because they work on 32-bit integers, and would truncate the numbers, hence using powers of two. |
|  [getKeyForTileKeyAndOffset(tileKey, offset, bitshift)](./harp-mapview.tileoffsetutils.getkeyfortilekeyandoffset.md) | Creates a unique key based on the supplied parameters. Note, the uniqueness is bounded by the bitshift. The \[\[TileKey.mortonCode()\]\] supports currently up to 26 levels (this is because 26\*2 equals 52, and 2^52 is the highest bit that can be set in an integer in Javascript), the bitshift reduces this accordingly, so given the default bitshift of four, we support up to 24 levels. Given the current support up to level 19 this should be fine. |
|  [getParentKeyFromKey(calculatedKey, bitshift)](./harp-mapview.tileoffsetutils.getparentkeyfromkey.md) | Returns the key of the parent. Key must have been computed using the function \[\[getKeyForTileKeyAndOffset\]\]. |
